title: Helkath-hazzurim
html: HELKATH-HAZZURIM(Helʹkath-haz·zuʹrim) [Field of Flint Knives; or, by an emendation, Field of Sides].A field near “the pool of Gibeon.” Twenty-four young men, 12 representing the armies of Ish-bosheth and 12 from the servants of David, died there while ‘putting on a combat.’ The place was subsequently named from this incident.—2Sa 2:12-16.
